pop_quiz_song1.question:
What word best completes this line in the poem?
'Through galaxies of stars and _____'

A.text: Rhymes with 'eyes', but doesn't make sense in context.

B.text: Fits the rhyme and the meaning! Also surreal and poetic!

C.text: Rhymes with 'through', but too silly for the line.

D.text: Rhymes with 'through', completely offbeat. Try another choice!

pop_quiz_song2.question:
What word completes this line best?
'Deep in the ocean, where echoes _____'

A.text: A good rhyming and thematic fit!

B.text: Rhymes well, but doesn't match the imagery of sound/echoes.

C.text: Too goofy. doesn't match the tone or rhyme.

D.text: No rhyme and unrelated to the ocean theme.

pop_quiz_song3.question:
Which word fits here?
'In moonlit gardens, where shadows _____'

A.text: Beautiful rhyme and fits the poetic tone.

pop_quiz_llm1.question: An AI trained on massive amounts of text can understand what words mean and use that understanding to answer questions, just like a human.

true.text: Not quite. While AI can predict words and patterns very well, it doesn't actually understand meaning like humans do.

false.text: Correct! AI doesn't truly understand meaning - it's actually very good at recognizing patterns in text and predicting what words should come next.

pop_quiz_llm2.question: What best describes the role of training data when building an AI?

options.text: A. It helps the AI memorize exact sentences
B. It teaches the AI emotional understanding
C. It feeds the AI examples so it can learn word patterns
D. It teaches the AI to translate spoken language into sound

a.text: Not quite. AI doesn't just memorize sentences - it learns patterns from them.

b.text: No, AI doesn't actually develop emotional understanding from training data.

c.text: Correct! Training data helps the AI learn patterns in how words and phrases are used together.

d.text: No, text training data isn't about sound translation.

pop_quiz_llm3.question:
After reading these phrases:
'The sun is shining.'
'The sun rises in the east.'
'The sun sets beautifully.'

What is the AI most likely to predict after seeing: 'The sun…'

a.text: No, 'sleeps' wasn't in any of the training examples.

b.text: No, 'dances' wasn't in any of the training examples.

c.text: Correct! Based on the training examples, 'is' appeared after 'The sun' and is therefore most likely to be predicted.

d.text: No, 'explodes' wasn't in any of the training examples.

pop_quiz_prompt1.question: What makes a prompt more likely to give a useful response from an AI?

options.text: B. Being vague so the AI can be creative
D. Asking multiple unrelated things at once

a.text: Short prompts can be helpful, but not if they leave out important details.

b.text: Vague prompts often lead to vague answers.

c.text: Yes! Clear, specific prompts help the AI understand exactly what you're looking for.

d.text: Too many unrelated requests can confuse the AI.

pop_quiz_prompt2.question: Which of these is the best prompt for writing a travel blog post?

options.text: D. Write a 3-paragraph blog post about visiting Jaipur, focusing on culture, food, and historical sites.

a.text: That's too vague and won't guide the AI well.

b.text: This prompt doesn't give enough direction or context.

c.text: It's slightly better, but still too general.

d.text: Correct! This prompt is specific and gives the AI clear instructions on content and structure.

pop_quiz_prompt3.question: What should you do if the AI's response isn't quite right the first time?

options.text: B. Keep repeating the same prompt
C. Refine the prompt with more detail or clarity

a.text: No need to give up! Try adjusting your prompt.

b.text: Repeating the same thing usually leads to the same result.

c.text: Exactly! Improving your prompt is the best way to guide the AI toward a better response.

d.text: That won't help. Instead, focus on giving clearer instructions.

pop_quiz_prompt4.question: Why is it helpful to set a “role” in your prompt, like saying 'You are a teacher…'?

options.text: A. So the AI knows how to behave or what tone to use
B. To make the prompt longer
D. It's required for the AI to work

a.text: Yes! Giving the AI a role helps it tailor its response to your needs.

b.text: Making the prompt longer isn't helpful unless it adds useful detail.

c.text: Actually, roles help guide the AI—they don't confuse it.

d.text: It's not required, but it definitely improves the results.
